IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Operation of an education facility for approximately 350 students grades 6 through 12.
IRS990.MissionDescription: At CSUS, we inspire motived learners to lead meaningful lives in a rapidly changing world. Our intimate collaborative community encourages students to pursue passions, explore new interests, build confidence, develop compassion and thrive in an environment of academic excellence.
IRS990.Description: Operation of an educational facility for approximately 350 students grades 6 through 12.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The intended uses of endowment funds are to support the mission and operations of the school as specified by the individual donors.
change in charitable remainder trust and scholarships

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: A public notice is published in the San Francisco Chronicle each year.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Financial aid in the form of tuition assistance is awarded to students based on financial need. Students apply for financial aid and scholarships are made on a sliding-scale basis based on a review of family income and other financial considerations. Awards are posted as credits to students' tuition balances and do not represent cash payments to students or their families.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: residence for personal use and house cleaning services

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A copy of the completed 990 is given to the Head of School and Board President for review prior to filing.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A conflict of interest policy is included in the employee handbook. All employees must sign that they have read and understood the policies included in the employee handbook. In addition, each board member officer and key employee is required to complete a conflict of interest statement each school year.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The process for determining compensation for the Head of School and CFO includes the use of benchmarks and market surveys. The Executive Committee of the Board approves the compensation annually.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization's governing documents, conflicts of interest policy, and financial statements are available to the public upon request in writing to the CFO.
